Description: Fragment of ring foot and base of Chian pottery plate. Very coarse, light grey clay (10 YR 7/2) in the core, yellowish brown (10 YR 6/4) outside, fired partly to reddish yellow (7.5 YR 6/6), with much silver mica and numerous white and bluish-green inclusions. Glaze fired red-brown. Interior, chalky white slip; two bands separate decorated fields: outside, frieze of lotus flowers and concentric rectangles; to the centre, lotus bud preserved amid thick fill. Exterior reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Identified as Chian with NAA by Hans Mommsen (sample Nauk 30). Schlotzhauer (2012) had previously pondered local production at Naukratis. Fabric and style link it to Ashmolean Museum G.117.9. See also A. Greifenhagen, AA 1936, 377 no.25 fig.29.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 31 no. A 29 pl. 8.1)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 185, no. Nau 160, pl. 35e-f)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2241)
